result.execSummary:
The defendant Pamela S Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred out of State if needed to accomodate husband's employment.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with any Wal-Mart stores. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Comply with any mental health or psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by agent. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pamela S Lowe in court with Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Terry L. makes statements.   Court sentences the Defendant to the following:    

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    *May be transferred out of state if need be due to husband's employment* 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: any Wal-Mart Stores
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate


FINE COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  10 Days Straight Time to commence, November 21, 2016 by 5:00 p.m.
2nd amended information
Sentencing hearing on November 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Pamela S Lowe in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1 of the Amended Information. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1 of the Amended Information. Case set for sentencing hearing. 2nd Amended Information to be filed (statutory reference needs to be corrected). Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
